FuncDef:
The priority command sets the priority of a DFS group.
The undo priority command restores the default priority of a DFS group. The priority command sets the priority of a DFS group. The undo priority command restores the default priority of a DFS group. By default, the priority of a DFS group is 100.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority of a DFS group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 254.

ExtraInfo: Two devices configured with M-LAG send negotiation packets to negotiate their master/backup status. M-LAG determines the master/backup status based on the priority and system MAC address. The device with a higher priority is the master. You can also run the priority command to set the M-LAG priority to determine the master/backup status of devices.
